poem:
Title: "The Weave of Deceit"

In the morning paper,
a square of black, white,
a man entwines with scandal.
Cloaked in PPE's golden promise,
his home in the North captured.

A stain of suspicion kissed,
on the lips of conspiracy.
Fraud, his alleged partner in crime,
cut through the estimates,
unraveled lives.

The news, cold,
matches our morning coffee.
Dreadfully unsweetened,
with fraud's surprising bite.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man, 46, arrested in connection with criminal investigation into PPE Medpro An arrest has been made in connection with the criminal investigation into PPE Medpro, the company that was awarded large government personal protective equipment contracts during the Covid pandemic. In a statement, the National Crime Agency (NCA) said a 46-year-old man had been arrested at his north London home. The man is understood to have been arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to commit fraud". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Man, 46, arrested in connection with criminal investigation into PPE Medpro An arrest has been made in connection with the criminal investigation into PPE Medpro, the company that was awarded large government personal protective equipment contracts during the Covid pandemic. In a statement, the National Crime Agency (NCA) said a 46-year-old man had been arrested at his north London home. The man is understood to have been arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to commit fraud
